[h1]Es bastante curioso[/h1]
Es obviamente de [b]puzzle[/b] que maneja
la intuición de manera bastante interesante.
[h1] Historia[/h1]
La historia es por demás [b]muy buena[/b]
es tan curiosa y cruda que te darás cuenta
que apenas ya empiezas, sabes que algo
no está bien. Lo único que no me gustó del
juego es su doblaje en Español España, no
es algo malo del juego pero no es de mi agrado.
[u]gracias por leer mi reseña[/u]

As good as the first one. ( ˘ ³˘)

Is this game better than the first? That depends. Portal 2 is slightly harder, much longer, and way funnier. However when I played through the first game I fell in love with the more thriller elements and was sad to see them almost entirely null in this one. This doesn't mean that this game is bad in any way. When I said it was way funnier than the first I meant it: there were multiple times when I took my hands off of my controller just to laugh and it was contrasted with moments of intrigue and sadness at times. The levels/puzzles are of a higher difficulty than the first but never overbearing so there's never any reason to get annoyed. I do kind-of have a problem with certain sections of the game where you're going through the levels with no real meaningful dialogue (I'd say this happens at around the 30%-45% and 80%-90% completion marks) but what good you've already experienced will motivate you enough to get to the better points.
